intro: Polyosma penibukanensis, commonly known as the Penibukan polyosma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, simple leaves with serrated edges. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
